title: Chiral de Rham complex and orbifolds
abstract: Suppose that a finite group <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="upper G"> <mml:semantics> <mml:mi>G</mml:mi> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">G</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula> acts on a smooth complex variety <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="upper X"> <mml:semantics> <mml:mi>X</mml:mi> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">X</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula>. Then this action lifts to the Chiral de Rham complex <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="normal upper Omega Subscript upper X Superscript c h"> <mml:semantics> <mml:msubsup> <mml:mi mathvariant="normal">Ω<!-- Ω --></mml:mi> <mml:mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mml:mi>X</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> <mml:mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mml:mi>ch</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> </mml:msubsup> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Omega ^{\operatorname {ch}}_{X}</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula> of <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="upper X"> <mml:semantics> <mml:mi>X</mml:mi> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">X</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula> and to its cohomology by automorphisms of the vertex algebra structure. We define twisted sectors for <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="normal upper Omega Subscript upper X Superscript c h"> <mml:semantics> <mml:msubsup> <mml:mi mathvariant="normal">Ω<!-- Ω --></mml:mi> <mml:mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mml:mi>X</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> <mml:mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mml:mi>ch</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> </mml:msubsup> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">\Omega ^{\operatorname {ch}}_{X}</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula> (and their cohomologies) as sheaves of twisted vertex algebra modules supported on the components of the fixed-point sets <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="upper X Superscript g Baseline comma g element-of upper G"> <mml:semantics> <mml:mrow> <mml:msup> <mml:mi>X</mml:mi> <mml:mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mml:mi>g</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> </mml:msup> <mml:mo>,</mml:mo> <mml:mi>g</mml:mi> <mml:mo>∈<!-- ∈ --></mml:mo> <mml:mi>G</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">X^{g}, g \in G</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula>. Each twisted sector sheaf carries a BRST differential and is quasi-isomorphic to the de Rham complex of <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="upper X Superscript g"> <mml:semantics> <mml:msup> <mml:mi>X</mml:mi> <mml:mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <mml:mi>g</mml:mi> </mml:mrow> </mml:msup> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">X^{g}</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula>. Putting the twisted sectors together with the vacuum sector and taking <inline-formula content-type="math/mathml"> <mml:math xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" alttext="upper G"> <mml:semantics> <mml:mi>G</mml:mi> <mml:annotation encoding="application/x-tex">G</mml:annotation> </mml:semantics> </mml:math> </inline-formula>-invariants, we recover the additive and graded structures of Chen-Ruan orbifold cohomology. Finally, we show that the orbifold elliptic genus is the partition function of the direct sum of the cohomologies of the twisted sectors.
